item.title: Linea team member showcases LXP with Witch Distribution Chart: Over half of low-tier users are witches
item.description: On August 28th, a member of the Linea team, @DeclanFox14, presented the airdrop voucher LXP on the X platform along with the Witch Distribution Chart. The image indicates that among users with 2000 LXP or less, more than half of the addresses were identified as witches. However, after exceeding 2000 LXP, the proportion of witches rapidly declined.@DeclanFox14 also verified that the witch identification work was analyzed by the Nansen team.

item.title: Matrixport has announced a strategic partnership with Fosun Wealth Holdings to jointly accelerate the global financial digitization process.
item.description: On August 28th, Matrixport made an announcement about entering into a strategic partnership with Fosun Wealth Holdings. The purpose of this partnership is to jointly expedite the global financial digitization process. The areas of focus for this collaboration will include digital asset custody, OTC (over-the-counter) trading, RWA (Real-World Assets), asset tokenization, and asset management products.The announcement pointed out that this significant milestone underscores the crucial role played by Web3 infrastructure and applications in traditional finance. It is expected to further drive the evolution of the financial industry in the directions of digitization, tokenization, and diversified asset allocation.

item.title: South Korea's Bitplanet is set to establish a Bitcoin Treasury company, planning to purchase $40 million worth of Bitcoin.
item.description: On August 28th, as per Bitcoin Magazine, Paul Lee, the Co-Founder and Managing Partner of Lobo Ventures, declared at the BITCOIN ASIA 2025 conference that Bitplanet is going to establish a Bitcoin treasury company and intends to purchase Bitcoin worth $40 million. Consequently, Bitplanet will emerge as South Korea's first global institutional Bitcoin financial company.

item.title: Foreign Media: Hong Kong Official Drops Out of Bitcoin Asia Conference to Avoid Contact with Eric Trump
item.description: August 28th. As per Bloomberg, Ashley Alder, the Executive Director of the Securities and Futures Commission (SFC) in Hong Kong, and Legislative Councilor Wu Chi-wai have been excluded from the guest list of the Bitcoin Asia Summit set to take place from August 28th to 29th. The previously archived page indicated that they were initially scheduled to be speakers but decided to withdraw after being advised against interacting with Eric Trump.Eric Trump, the son of former US President Donald Trump, is one of the speakers at the event. He currently serves as the Executive Vice President of the Trump Organization and is involved in multiple US crypto projects. The SFC responded that Alder could not attend due to a business trip, while Wu Chi-wai stated that he had to cancel his trip due to family reasons.Furthermore, according to the South China Morning Post, informed sources reported that both individuals withdrew because they were instructed not to interact with Eric Trump, th

item.title: Founder of Sandbox Steps Down and Lays Off 50% of Staff, Shifts Focus from Metaverse to Web3 Applications and Launchpad Initiative
item.description: August 28th. As per The Big Whale, The Sandbox's co-founders Arthur Madrid and SÃ©bastien Borget have relinquished their day-to-day operational responsibilities. Animoca Brands CEO Robby Yung has assumed the role of CEO. Borget will act as a global ambassador, and Madrid will become a non-executive chairman. Simultaneously, the company has downsized its staff by over 50%, encompassing teams in Argentina, Uruguay, South Korea, Thailand, and Turkey. It is planning to shut down its office in Lyon, France, and further layoffs are anticipated in Paris. This restructuring is regarded as a strategic adjustment driven by technological progress.Moreover, The Sandbox is gradually shifting its emphasis away from its metaverse business and moving towards a wider scope of Web3 applications, including the launch of a Base-based memecoin.

item.title: Former Governor of the People's Bank of China Zhou Xiaochuan: Stablecoins May Trigger Speculation, Limited Advantage in Cross-Border Payments
item.description: On August 28th, as reported by Bloomberg, former central bank governor Zhou Xiaochuan cautioned in a closed-door meeting held in mid-July that stablecoins have the potential to trigger speculative behavior, thereby endangering financial stability.Zhou Xiaochuan pointed out that stablecoins offer only limited advantages over China's existing retail payment system in terms of cost, and the claim that traditional cross-border payments are "very costly" may be overstated. He also stated that the regulatory frameworks in the US, Hong Kong, and Singapore have not yet fully met the requirement that stablecoins should be "fully backed by liquid assets," emphasizing the need to be vigilant against their excessive use on speculative asset trading platforms, which could lead to fraud and systemic risks.

item.title: SharpLink has transferred 23.46 million U funds to Galaxy Digital, potentially for ETH accumulation.
item.description: On August 28th, according to the monitoring of The Data Nerd, SharpLink (SBET) transferred 23.46 million USDC to the Galaxy Digital address 20 minutes ago. This transfer may be intended to increase holdings of ETH.

item.title: The prediction on Polymarket that "Bitcoin will fall below $100,000 by the end of the year" has a 61% probability.
item.description: On August 28th, although some analysts hold the view that Bitcoin's price will reach $200,000 by 2026, the majority of Polymarket bettors are wagering that by the end of this year, Bitcoin's price will decline below $100,000.As of Wednesday, the trading volume betting on whether Bitcoin will fall below $100,000 this year indicates that the likelihood of dropping below $100,000 is 61%. This figure is slightly lower than the prediction on Monday when 72% of bettors forecasted that Bitcoin's trading price would once again drop below $100,000 this year.Presto Research analyst Min Jung stated: "Up to now, the large-scale sell-offs by whales and long-term holders have encountered sufficient buyer demand - especially from corporate treasuries and institutional allocators. However, the crucial question is whether there are enough new entrants to absorb this supply if these large holders start to unwind more aggressively. If demand fails to keep up, breaking below $100,000 becomes more like

item.title: Aethir provides Arizona State University with a $3 million grant to launch a global Artificial Intelligence and Blockchain Education Program
item.description: August 28th, the decentralized GPU cloud network Aethir entered into a partnership with Arizona State University (ASU) to initiate a global AI and blockchain education program. The program is designed to promote AI and blockchain innovation within the education sector. Arizona State University is the first university to collaborate with OpenAI. Through this partnership, Aethir will provide a grant of $3 million to the university, allowing students and researchers to access advanced infrastructure and expertise. The first batch of incubation projects is scheduled to commence in the 2025-2026 academic year.

item.title: infini Founder Christian sold 2477 ETH 10 hours ago, and the ETH in a single address has been completely withdrawn
item.description: On August 28th, according to on-chain analyst Ai Yi (@ai_9684xtpa), the founder of infini, Christian (@Christianeth), is said to have sold 2477 ETH (approximately $11.66 million) 10 hours ago, nearly selling at the peak of last night. Among them, 1257 ETH was sold through Cowswap at an average price of $4,777.6, and another 1220 ETH was deposited into Binance. If sold this time, the address will have emptied its holdings of ETH.
